mtycKqmWCWwFrKK5ycq3rg.text: Best pizza in Pittsburgh and I've been to a lot of places!   It's a little hard to find, but it's worth it. I have no doubt Michigan and Trumbull will be making it big in the Steel City. The four corner Detroit style pizza is unique, especially in a city that isn't known for their pizza.  The flavors are incredible! You will not be disappointed.  I also bought one to take home for dinner the next day.   Don't forget about the waffle fries and arugula salad, perfect combination with a pizza.

1eDh7DCTXEhUcEsW_cPrXw.text: Great pizza, and in a town that is not known for many good pizza options.   We went to the Federal Galley last night specifically to try Detroit style pizza, and outside of a hard time finding parking because of the Pirates game going on at the same time there was no negative.  We ordered two pizzas to split between three of us and got them to cut the pizzas into six cuts instead of four.  The first thing was received is the white pizza. I'm from Northeastern PA and an area known for its great pizza....but this is easily the best white pizza I've ever had. The lemony smell and slight lemony taste was great, and not overpowering at all. The crust was thick and crispy, burnt to a golden brown. Thinking about this pizza now makes me want to go back and get some more already.  I also tried the chorizo pizza and that was also very good. Similar crust but obviously totally different taste. The chorizo was good. It had decent spice but was hardly spicy. I'd give this one more of a four star compared to the white pizza but it was still very good.

yTYCR1zhiM0WsK5My-ktCg.text: This is the best pizza in Pittsburgh. The sauce is delicious. The options are amazing. This is my first Yelp review, I was saving it for something to die for!!!

u80Xfkz1F48AKgfs-9Kq8Q.text: Michigan & Trumbull is legit. I will preface this by admitting I had never had a Detroit-style pizza before my visit tonight to M&T at Federal Galley. I do fancy myself a pizza enthusiast, however, and this place reminded me why. The dough is light, airy and succulent. The flavors were on point. That by itself would be enough for a return visit, but to top it off, Kristin (of Kristin and Nate, proprietors and chefs of M&T) is the bees knees. She schooled me on what makes a good Detroit-style pizza, and honestly a good pizza period. We shared stories on dough experiments and I left with a hunger to make more pizza at home. And to return to Michigan & Trumbull - because there isn't much better than good pizza coupled with good people.

gsYE1zrfkyQAxhYw461YAw.text: Best deep dish pizza Ive ever had. The owner really cares about your experience and is really sweet. Their ingredients are fresh, tasty, abd innovative. I Would eat here everyday if my wallet and waist would allow!

VI3LFWQjazyFKlFzbvn3ig.text: We visited for lunch and absolutely loved it!  We went with the arugula salad and the Packard pizza.  The lemon dressing gave such a great balance to the peppery arugula.  The pizza was phenomenal!  The hot honey was such a great addition.  I can't wait to come back and try other options!

BbXeWUNs5H35ioxpysmNeA.text: This place knows how to make a good pizza. Fluffy in the middle and a crispy crust! Toppings are top notch! Sensational salads for those who aren't looking for carbs. Washing it all down with a Vernors ginger ale is the end of a perfect meal. This place the gem of a new place in the heart of the Northside.

2ByQWhaRwMD7TiNXgDrE-g.text: This is the most awful pizza I've ever eaten. The sauce is sour and the crust was WAY over cooked. This is not the experience that you want to have when looking for a good pizza place.  Just look at the burnt gross pictures they have on here.  Don't eat here!

a-riLwt-WyaJfStHOsaIwQ.text: Best pizza I've had in Pittsburgh! Kristen is so enthusiastic and nice every time we visit,  it's definitely become a regular spot since moving here from the Detroit area.

photos.caption: Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States. Woodward ave and chorizo pizza pictured

Si0X10Apf8gI6-iMU-P8KA.text: Awesome detroit style pizza and the staff are super nice.  Great ingredients and always great tasting. Highly recommend.

iV0BuAN04Dm2HaYSrUuhUg.text: Amazing.  Burnt cheese on the ends, pickled jalapenos and extra sauce.  Cant wait to go back.

Rr9D2io_z4ETK7OIMuKimA.text: Amazing New style of  Pizza! so lucky to have it in Pittsburgh PA. The crunchy crust and charred bits of cheese are a foodies dream come True....

nw85g8MAyrX0ZeI7Ewzsxw.text: Recently discovered Detroit-style pizza in NC and rushed back to Pittsburgh to find it here. Michigan and Trumbull DSP is extreme yumminess! Get a fancy combination pizza (or we often like getting plain cheese with 'shrooms and/or pepperoni.) Cheese to the edge gives you that bubbly, cheesy, carmelized awesomeness. The crust is like a soft pizza pillow - melts in your mouth! Oh, and the sauce is outstanding too - very fresh and "tomato-forward". An added bonus - the owners and staff are really nice, cool people too.

nAFXbalXshdlcEbAeyUMHg.text: This place in # federal gallery never disappoints! Their pizzas are incredible. The crust is out-of-thisworld and the combinations of pizza they come up with are delicious.

uX1z7GYSVgiHfYjokD8Zvw.text: Oh. My. What. Pittsburgh has changed a lot over the years, but one thing that eluded me was my perfect pizza. Some are ok, a little too chewy, a little too greasy, taste like nothing, on and on. I never found my soulmate pizza. Neither did my Jersey husband. When people ask us where to get good pizza I always jokingly say, "parkway east, turnpike, and head east for at least 6 hours." We came to Federal Gallery on a whim after a dinner party fell through, and we were determined not to waste a sitter. I love a thicker crust pizza, and I heard rumblings of Detroit-style here. Saw the packard pepperoni and my tiny heart had pangs of hope, but I've been fooled so many times before. Then the pizza comes out. I raised my arms involuntarily in triumph. "Are you ok?" Says the girl dropping the food. No miss. No ma'am. And it tasted better than it looked! Salty, crispy, thick but somehow light, gloriousness. I legit almost cried. My husband and I finished with absolute glee. We walked back to look at the other pizzas and I saw a woman who I remembered in an article as being one of the owners. "Ohhhh I'm going to go hug her" I say to my husband. He informed me it would be unwise to surprised someone who was crouched in front of a blazing oven. Ok. Fair enough. But you've been warned Michigan and Trumbull pizza genius people. Watch out for random hugs!

AB6smX3cX1_SjVHlomQmkA.text: This pizza is amazing!!!! I wish I lived close by to eat it everyday! It's cut into 4 slices so it's perfect for a couple of small group. It's so delicious with the crunchy cheese around the outside. The crust is light and flakey. It is simply everything! I was stuffed with just a few slices but couldn't wait to have my left overs later on

Ue2YFUA6vtfnvGc1GZdcEg.text: I had the pleasure of finally trying this super instagram worthy pizza last night during a foodie blogger meet up and it was everything I imagined! The thick crispy crust is what makes a pizza delicious in my opinion, but of course some delicious toppings don't hurt either. I went with half of the special Quattro Fromaggio and half Vegan (because I was really curious about the egglplant). The 4 cheese definitely stole the show but I would recommend the vegan to any of my plant loving friends. I will definitely be back to try to the pepperoni and the white! Also I must note the customer service was excellent- a big win in my book!

kAtPoGozo3r9zcLfYg1wlQ.text: Delicious. This Detroit style pizza is taking Pittsburgh by storm! The burnt cheese on the crust give this pizza a unique texture and amazing twist on flavor. Don't let the pizza distract you from the BBQ waffle fries with cilantro ranch dressing. My husband had been talking about them non stop. Get there. Get the ZA. Get the fries. Be happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States

9tU6ZzIYAV5zReTQpTZ-Zg.text: As a relocated Detroiter, Michigan & Trumbull is the perfect taste of home. The other Pittsburgh Detroit style pizzerias in town are Jets (a local favorite chain-pizza, but still a chain-pizza) and Iron Born (who seem to use Detroit-style pizza as opportunistically and inauthentically as their silly name).  Unlike the competition, Kristen and Nate have created a beautiful love letter to Detroit pizza that both masters the technique and enhances it. The names of each pie will be familiar to any Detroiter, and the flavors range from familiar to inspired.  The Packard Pepperoni is a neat twist on the standard pepperoni pizza that introduces pickled chiles and hot honey for a spicy/sweet delicious pizza. The St Aubin Sausage and Bagley Chorizo are totally new ideas that I would be surprised to see on a Detroit pizzeria's menu, but they are executed with delicious perfection.  The Woodward Ave White is as much a standout as the road that is its namesake. Ricotta cheese, garlic oil, pepper flakes and lemon zest combine to create a unique and delicious flavor.  Michigan & Trumbull gets bonus points for authenticity by stocking Vernors and Faygo beverages, both being favorite Detroit products. They take it up a further notch with their delicious Detroit style Coney Dogs, offered as a special item on Mondays.  Kristen and Nate haven't forgotten about brunch either. They generally offer a pizza with ham or eggplant, topped with roasted tomatoes and a basil pesto that is my favorite brunch item in town. It is often joined by a brioche waffle, topped with whatever the hell they want to blow your mind in a given week. I have never been disappointed.

6A5nH6iajtB27uDcTa7wXw.text: Great! I do love Federal Galley - so mostly anything out of this place is exciting to me. I've tried the pizza at Michigan & Trumbull twice and was not disappointed! The first go-round was a standard pizza (tasty and perfectly cooked) and a side of the fries they offer... with that delicious sauce... sooo. delicious.  The second round was with a group of friends. I'm not exactly sure what the name of the pizza was, but it was the one with Mikes Hot Honey on it. YES! So. Good. I loved the combination of flavors and hot honey is tasty on nearly everything - but gave a perfect sweet kick to this pizza. If you like spicy food, definitely try this one! (even though I don't know the name...)

p1WrtdPcCOg6c4iGxwHD5w.text: I don't trust people who don't like pizza. I love that Michigan and Trumble aren't out to reinvent the wheel. They promise good Detroit style pizza and they deliver. They actually don't literally deliver but that would be cool if they did. I always go for the white pizza. It's like a cheese overload and that hint of lemon zest though gets me every time. They also have waffle fries that are delicious with their ranch but I always feel like a glutton so I don't order both at the same time but both is good. I wish they would put the fries on the pizza so I could give them all my monies but I understand why they don't. You can't have the best of everything on one thing.  I have zero complaints about this place as they absolutely know what they're doing. I appreciate the consistency and the fact that I can't by pizza by the slice instead just buy the box and eat some for lunch, dinner and breakfast because adulthood. Also, don't forget to get a sticker on your way out. They're always rotating them and they're hilarious.

photos.caption: Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States. Buffalo Chicken Pizza
Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States. Quatro pizza and half Woodward White

dtmSOdRG8Tlnivc2BnWpeA.text: They make a really tasty and unique style of pizza - crispy outer crust with a softer, toasty middle. I really like the twists their menu offers including daily special recipes, but they also allow you to build your own pizza if you want something more traditional. The staff was very friendly and, despite the cafeteria-esque model of Federal Galley, we felt like we had a bonafide Michigan and Trumbull experience. We will be back to try more of their delicious pizza!

fAgpFFf3920cycJGieTPSA.text: DH & I decided to take the kids over to the Children's Museum for an outing.  Well, I also said let's go because I had heard of the Federal Gallery opening and wanted to check it out.  I was already a big fan of Smallman Galley, and Federal Galley doesn't disappoint!  We walked in and scoped out all the places.  Michigan & Trumbull really caught my eye. Having never heard of Detroit Style pizza, I was intrigued.  Pittsburgh being the town of delicious and unique Pizza, I was curious to see if this placed lived up to all the hype.  Indeed it did!  The Pizza was thick and crunchy on the outside and soft and sweet on the inside.  Toppings were well placed, with a hint of sweetness to boot.  This pizza is not for the faint of heart.  It's definitely an indulge type of day.  DH & I split the Packard Pepperoni with pickled chiles and hot honey, along with the Waffle Fries or Tender Fries as they call them!  It was a heavy meal, but well worth the weight in calories.  The Waffle Fries were exceptionally good and served alongside a cilantro ranch (which I could swim in, really!).  I'll be back for sure, next time I'm in the burgh.  Which is well, this weekend, YAY!

YdAE5fDzKWPbQyyLN7WmnQ.text: So when my Girlfriend asked me how my pizza was, I had to gather myself... I didn't want to be a creature of the moment, and say something outlandish. I took a deep breath, another bite of my pepperoni pizza, and declared that it was the best that I've had in Pittsburgh... Not only do I think that this might be an understatement, it could be flat out insulting. This might be the best Pizza that I have ever had. Perfectly cooked, perfect toppings, sweet, savory, spicy. All in all, an amazing slice of Pie. I wouldn't change a thing.

photos.caption: Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States. The Packard Pepperoni is now the Gold Standard on which I will judge all other Pizzas.

eVCQk8JSvq5VBrdb3RCGuQ.text: The white pizza was very good.  Enjoyed the thicker bread like soft crust that is crisp on the bottom and edges.  The topping of mozzarella, ricotta, red pepper flakes, lemon zest and garlic oil was evident but wish it had just a tad more garlic. You get a pie that is about 8 by 10 inches and cooked in a metal pan to make the crust crunchy.  Will definitely return some time and try another style.

9QchmlTowBPtgRoFHBED_g.text: Service was good. Pizza was Detroit style which outside of little Caesar's I've never had Detroit style. Honestly if blind folded I wouldn't have been able to tell the difference

RK-CNJLs6zvvRJXDhPW_gg.text: Related to Chicago Deep Dish. Square 8x10", 4 slice pizzas.  One size fits all!   Sausage Pizza was surprisingly blah. Most distinctive flavor was the dollop of marinara sauce on top (though listed as a red pizza,  it isn't really).  Burned crust (apparently a Detroit thing...) No condiments provided (cheese or red pepper).  Restaurant is hidden inside the Federal Galley food court along with the Provision restaurant - no signs outside!

photos.caption: Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States
Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States

D4QsIiH9eqTn-75cBLe-sg.text: This has been my favorite food since the day I first tried it. So delicious and amazing service! It is unlike any other pizza I've had, and I LOVE it! Do yourself a favor and go get some!

IBvTkIqGCo28yZfXAWDmWQ.text: I eat a lot of pizza. I mean a lot. This is by far one of the best pizzas I have ever eaten in my lifetime. The packard pepperoni, the specials - eggplant parm and fancy Nancy - are just all, oh my, amaze balls. You HAVE to eat there. There just isn't any other option if you love pizza. Go. Eat. Fall in love. Please never leave us M&T.

6VcmtdTPclbGwDaSrGugmg.text: The crust was delicious. We tried the packard pepperoni pizza. The hot honey was the kicker that made the pizza over the top.

lCUSXI28uQ_GvbDQVTE6kQ.text: Ok.  Pittsburgh.  New pizza in the Burgh.   We all have our favorites and this is now added to my list.  This is an astonishingly awesome pizza.  Sauce is wonderful and the variety of their standard pizzas is exquisite.  Quite the treat.  Then if you want to customize, go to town and create your own.  We are currently working our way through their list and have not even had a bad bite.   Each pizza comes with the crispy cheese crust.  Yum.  I never eat the crust on pizza until now. Ok folks. Enjoy.   Ok. PS THE NEW EXPANDED MENU MAKES IT EVEN MORE AWESOME!

qLWCZU8A_m4C8raCjndxog.text: Being originally from the Detroit area, they have truly done Pittsburgh a favor by introducing the city to this type of pizza!  They were great people and in talking my boyfriend tells them I'm from Detroit.  They came to ask how we liked our pizza and it was seriously soooo good!  The teader fries mimicked BetterMade chips.  If you're from Detroit, BetterMade chips were a food group.  They also sell Faygo & Vernors, other Detroit staples.  We just had the pepperoni pizza, but will definitely be back.  Pittburghers act like they barely know where Detroit is, but I'm glad Michigan & Trumbull are here to represent!  Oh and I love that the pizza are named for popular streets in Detroit.  Next, they need a Coney Dog pizza.

PZXRhBWqg8fBlHk3qEqVmA.text: This pizza is so good. Has a great flavor. The crust is not too soft and not to hard. I had the Woodward ave white pizza. It has mozzarella cheese ricotta cheese red pepper flakes for some spice garlic and a touch of lemon zest. No red sauce. Perfect combo. Price is t too bad either for the size. Pizzas are all shareable but if your hungry you can eat one yourself. I also had the arugula salad.  This was also so good. The House vinaigrette they use is perfect. Very light but a great taste

dY1YnkXlWeAVF5wwmojZfw.text: This is the best Pizza in Pgh. Thick cut, cast iron Pizza. Even my VERY favorite dishes from my VERY favorite restaurants I could tell you at least ONE thing that could be different to get a better taste, but not here. Everything is literally perfect. Nothing could make any bite better. It's perfect.

ycRc4YZhe9bYUa7WQb1ZpA.text: The only place I've ever ordered from, and to be honest, I've only ever tried the Woodard Ave White. The ricotta with lemon zest is the best thing. I wish there was more than just a dollop on each slice... like I want it covering my pizza. I also think arugula would be a delicious addition/topping. Regardless its ah-mazing!!

Y13G54wcf1cqcJ7ar2cXXQ.text: Perfect crust, perfect sauce, perfect toppings. That is all you need to know! I love this pan pizza/Detroit-style pizza trend. Keep it going! I've had two different pies when I've gone to Michigan and Trumbull, one was a spicy pie with pepperoni, peppers and hot honey. The other was a chorizo pie with cilantro ranch and pickled red onion. Both were so good and the chorizo pie was really unique and perfect. I know I should branch out at Federal. Everything looks so good at all the restaurants. However, it is very hard when this pizza is so amazing!

7kc3yvD-WujuQ2YwxOjXkg.text: Detroit roots living in Denver and visiting Pittsburgh - Yes, as good as it gets! The cheese pull, the flavors, the timing, the friendliness, even the Vernors was the perfect temp! We went with an Arugula Salad (dressing was phenomenal!) and the Packard Pepperoni (honey was a sweet touch to balance the peppers, we loved it!) Both items were beyond delicious, can't recommend enough. Also a sucker for food halls and community dining, Federal Galley was approachable with well-defined areas comfortable for large groups or a romantic two-person, 6-pizza-square affair. Sort of felt like we discovered a secret, but the place was bumping! Good times. Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States. packard pepperoni  red sauce, mozzarella, pickled chiles, pepperoni, hot honey
Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States. arugula salad parmesan, housemade croutons, lemon zest, house vinaigrette ​

VdDYQERtkOQk9pG-R9w2rg.text: Out of all the current restaurants in Federal Galley, I think Michigan & Trumbull has the best fries. I also ordered the McLovin pizza and it honestly tastes better than the Big Mac, which inspired this pizza. The crust is crisp while the inside of the pizza is soft but not soggy.

photos.caption: Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States
Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States

dklSRVNdcXv9RVVa2PGiQg.text: I'm not a fan of deep dish pizza. But, oh my...this was amazing.  If I were to say "one bite everyone knows the rules" I'd give this a solid 9.9 out of ten. We had the Woodward White. A deep dish with mozzarella, ricotta, red pepper flake, lemon zest, and garlic oil...it was a.m.a.z.i.n.g!  Love it. Will definitely come back.   And Federal Galley in general is just awesome. I come here often and it's such a cool concept. I hope Michigan & Trumbull stays forever.

0596VOVQVYgvw0EwNHcN_A.text: Federal Galley spotlight-Michigan and Trumbull. Whenever I visit Federal Galley these days it's for the purpose of introducing family and friends who have never had the opportunity to experience it.  I took my daughter here today since she is a pizza lover. Catching up with their chefs- Kristen Calverley and Nate Peck,they were glad to meet her. Their recommendation to us was the Woodward Ave white pizza. This pizza comes with mozzarella, ricotta, red pepper flake, lemon zest, and olive oil.   Nate told us it is normally cut in quarters but it could be cut 6 ways if we preferred. We thought since we were sharing that 4 cuts would be enough. The size was 8x10 inch pizza.  I explained to my daughter the drill-take a number, grab your napkins, utensils, and plates from a nearby station and sit down. Federal Galley for some reason was fairly empty this visit but finding parking was nearly impossible!! Guess it all depends upon the time you go.  We got our pizza within a reasonable length of time. My daughter was thrilled to learn they put some cheese in the burnt appeared crust. With all the cheeses the two slices were quite filling. In addition you can really taste the red pepper. Good thing we had plenty of water to drink.  My daughter really liked the way it was prepared and appreciated the chef style in which it was made.  Michigan and Trumbull also serves fries, salads, and even has a brunch menu for Sats and Suns. Open daily they make a welcome addition for upscale pizza in the Pittsburgh North Side neighborhood.

photos.caption: Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States. Woodward Ave White pizza
Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States. Ordering area

dfWmTWxJT59frY4u1cW9Gw.text: I love this pizza. Don't make me compare it to Ironborn's version of Detroit pizza, because I love them, too.   I tried the Packard Pepperoni. It's excellent. The dough is lighter than it looks (but not quite as airy as Ironborn's), and it supports this pizza so well.   There's a little honey on top, which sounds strange at first, but works so well with this flavor mix.   The arugula salad is also tops, with a tangy house dressing with just a little spice  "bite" to it.    Love it - I will be back.

7CGc34yoX5KR88kYO1sUTw.text: I absolutely love the food this joint is slinging. I mean how can you go wrong with Detroit-style pizza? And they had me at Teader Fries!  Seriously fresh and natural ingredients with flavors that really tempt the senses.  The Woodward White pizza is so damn good. Perfectly blended cheeses with lemon zest that's bold without being overpowering.  Getting the Packard on our next visit!

lij8khTrHLHGF_97GqSC9g.text: I stopped by here a couple of Mondays ago with my wife for dinner.  We had come to the Federal Galley as part of a wonderful Yelp event and after trying all of the restaurants decided to finish our dinner with a pizza from Michigan and Trumbull.  As with all of the restaurants in the Galley this is a walk up counter where you place your order, they give you a number and then deliver your food to you at your table.  Due to that there isn't too much to say about the "restaurant" itself.  They do serve Michigan style pizzas here which means that they are cooked in a cast iron type skillet which gives it a nice crust.  For dinner on this evening my wife and I decided to split the bagley chorizo.  The menu described the bagley chorizo as a pizza with mozzarella, pickled red onions, chorizo and cilantro ranch.  After only a couple of minute wait our pizza was brought out to us.  It looked delicious, especially the caramelized edges and crust but I couldn't help but wonder about it's size (4 pieces) for the $16 that it cost.  Thankfully it tasted as good as it looked as the crust had a nice and crispy exterior while the chorizo brought the spice and the pickled onions added a much appreciated hit of acidity.  Combine that with the cilantro ranch drizzle and it was a really cohesive pizza.  The bottom line for me is that I would stop by here again in the future.  Their pizza was delicious and although I am not sure it was worth the cost, I do enjoy supporting local businesses.

photos.caption: Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States. Bagley Chorizo

gZjgnG4SCgZR7G7A6_Loew.text: A bit pricey, and I was worried I'd be disappointed. However, the pizza was very filling and I only ended up being able to eat 3/4 of it. I got the one that has cheese and lemon zest...can't remember what it was called. The edge of the pizza looks burned, but apparently, that's what makes a Detroit style pizza. You spread the cheese to the edges and it bakes in. It was so flipping delicious that the crust was my favorite part (and I've been known to leave my crust on the plate now and then). The dough was light, moist and yet crispy on all the edges. Just perfect!

photos.caption: Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States. OMG - yum, love the crust

p9OCbWJy3RnIumnBvlSoHA.text: OMGOMGOMG.   This Detroit-style pizza is the truth.   Thick crust, bubbling, crisp cheesy edges with flavorful sauce just waiting to flow upon your first bite like the river Brittany Spears cried for Justin Timberlake...  And they've got gluten-free pizza! And it's really good!  Just keep in mind that this square pie is filling. It would have been hard for me to each an entire pizza by myself, although at first look it's not too daunting. But each slice is rich, and the crust is thick and delicious, so make sure you've brought your appetite.  I was loving the whole vibe of Federal Galley, but this place right here was my most memorable bite.

QmZYUmqmf-ux6jDIwYiwsw.text: I'm so relieved to not have to rely on just Little Caesars detroit-style pizza (which is surprisingly good, but, it's Little Caesars). I went with the Packard Pepperoni pizza that was absolutely delicious - the mixture of crispy pepperoni, sweetness from the honey, and acidity from the peppers worked wonders together.   The pizza itself was perfectly cooked, and the sauce and cheese paired together beautifully. The chef (owner?) was nice enough to stop by after we finished eating which we appreciated as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States. Yup, this was delicious. The honey is a great touch.

iEf9SZbi2QEkM50zRvpVuQ.text: Insanely good. A must try. Detroit style is like a pan but done square. The dough is perfect, zesty sauce, right amount of cheese. They do some unique toppings too like the hot honey. Does not disappoint.

Qy1cfatffY1iC0CQcNNrzQ.text: As a New York City transplant to Pittsburgh I am rarely  impressed by pizza but yinz gotta eat here! I have it delivered now almost once a week.   Service is phenomenal. The owners take pride and care in the ingredients and reputation, which is obvious in the taste and customer service. After the corporate conglomerate Grubhub never delivered our pizza to our home we went to Michigan & Trumbull in person and explained our dilemma. They were appalled and promptly gave us the same order free of charge because, 'our food and our reputation is everything.' From a fellow business owner- those words mean the difference between a successful business and a failing one.  I am confident this restaurant will not only be here in Pitt for years to come but there will most likely be a waitlist to get in, so hurry now to get it without the line....

kIjYFYdVR2PYoZTUdrm3Rw.text: Okay, Michigan & Trumbull is literally so good. You can find this new spot in Federal Galley (part of the old Allegheny Center Mall - it's location is literally in an old bank vault. How cool is that?   This shared space features other restaurants and a bar settled in the middle of the Galley, but the main event was finally getting to try M&T. We hit it up for lunch around 12:00pm - it was busy, but we didn't have to wait to order and the food was delivered about 10-15 minutes later) we also were able to grab a table right away.   I ordered the Woodward Ave White pizza - a Detroit style pizza featuring (mozzarella, ricotta, hot pepper flakes, lemon zest, and garlic oil) - this pizza was out of this world and like something I never tasted before. It was delicious. My one coworker also ordered this pizza as well.   My other coworker ordered the Bagley Chorizo (mozzarella, pickles red onion, chorizo, and cilantro ranch) - I didn't get to try it, but she loved it.   We shared an order of the Teader Fries (crispy waffle fries, bbq chip spice, and cilantro ranch) - these were some of the best "fries" I've ever had.   We also ordered the Garlic Knots - they are literally as big as my fist. They are the best garlic knots I've ever had.   I'm bringing all the friends and family - Michigan & Trumbull is the best.

photos.caption: Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States
Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States
Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States

-ebyt8GfhxdQPFVnGiYOFQ.text: I didn't want to like it because the staff there was very unfriendly and didn't really seem to care if you came or went. But you have to give credit where credit is due. Delicious crust - crispy around sides and light and fluffy in the center. Crisp pepperoni and gooey cheese... Nice sauce. Pretty close to perfection.

58GZCLmmps4z96OjBvFDCw.text: Michigan and Trumbull...where do I begin? By now I would expect the word to have traveled far about how incredible their pizza is. One of the four food vendors in Federal Galley, I have brought numerous out-of-town guests and family members here just to try the pie. And the consensus is strong - everyone loves their pie. I was so extremely ecstatic to initially find out their dough is vegan friendly. And off the bat they had an awesome vegan pizza on the menu. That just warms my heart. The original vegan pie was killer, with roasted eggplant and a walnut romesco, topped with scallions and cilantro. It was unique and I've never had a pairing quite like that on a pizza before, but of course it was delicious. I was excited when I saw they updated their vegan pie, it's now a red sauce, unlimited choice of vegetables, and topped with arugula....and just $8! Price cannot be beat for the size of the pie! The slices, four to a pie, are quite filling. And every time I saw my boyfriend enjoying the "Packard Pepperoni" - red sauce, mozzarella, pickled chiles (which I always steal), pepperoni and hot honey, I was always yearning for the juicy deliciousness of their vibrant red sauce. 10/10 for the new vegan pie. I always see their "Teader Fries" as a big seller, crispy waffle fries with BBQ chip spice, served with cilantro ranch. Dying to give them a try but the pizza is always more than enough. Not too long ago they added some new salads as well. They're super active on Instagram so if you're active be sure to check for weekly specials or closures due to private events. I think I read this duo is moving back to their hometown of Detroit, I don't even want to know when that will be. Until then, I'll get myself to Federal Galley as often as it is healthy to eat pizza at every meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States. vegan pie. incredible. red sauce with unlimited toppings! roasted broccoli, mushrooms and arugula

MtdwA3tZyJr491AHPSd6Yw.text: I have to say that I didn't know what Detroit-style pizza was until a couple of months ago. It has quickly become a staple. M&T is my favorite Detroit-style shop in the city. There is something about that square thick dough that speaks to me on a spiritual level. I'm obsessed. I find M&T's version less salty and the dough is softer.   The first time I tried one with a white sauce and what I believe was arugula. The pizza itself was great, just too many greens. Since then I've stuck with the Packard Pepperoni. Don't be scared by "pickled chiles."  They're not overly hot and the hot honey adds the perfect sweetness. It is pepperoni pizza perfection. I would love to branch out, I just love Packard so much.   Seriously, go get this pie. It is amazing.  Oh, and they now have gluten free crust!

photos.caption: Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States

qYCHtk_bmkdecjs5ZMYsrQ.text: The Packard Pepperoni pie is delicious. The pizza has a nicely golden brown to burnt bottom that is complimented with a light red sauce with delicious notes of hot honey on top of fresh mozzarella.   The environment of the building is great with indoor and outdoor seating. There is a large bar in the middle to meet all your beverage needs.

photos.caption: Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States

l_prDN4hw0p0exIf3WC11Q.text: I Love Pizza.   Went here on a stopover in Pittsburgh. I rarely will write a review on Yelp unless something is tremendously good or bad.   This pizza is UNIQUE, INCREDIBLE & was a huge shock!  I live in New Jersey and there is no shortage of great pizza and different styles there and in NYC.   I have never had a type of pizza like at M&T. I can't really describe it well, but the dough Was light and crispy but not overdone. Thick but not like Chicago style.   Tremendously good. I got the McLovin (Mozzarella, Cheddar, Seasoned Beef, White Onion, sauce and sesame seed). Best pizza I've had in years and one of best ever. Also got their Woodward Ave White ( Mozzarella, Ricotta, Red Pepper Flake, Lemon Zest and garlic oil).   Run, don't walk to this pizza place. Great venue too. Evidently this is Detroit style pizza. Never heard of it.

4ehbOWvq04DgDannbLbXxQ.text: My boyfriend is from Michigan, and we absolutely love Buddy's pizzas around Detroit.  We have been searching everywhere for something similar and we have found it at Michigan & Trumbull!  The crust is crunchy and delicious, the sauce is on top of the cheese and tomato-y and perfectly sweet and tangy.  It's a little pricy, you get six small 3x3 cuts for 10$, plus 2-3$ per topping.  Specialty pizzas are 16$.  Two could share for a lunch portion.  It's definitely fancier than a regular pizza place, as are most of the other eateries housed in Federal Galley, some of the toppings include pickled onions and goat cheese, garbanzo beans etc. But that's what makes it stand out, you can always keep your toppings simple. It's a very popular lunch spot for good reason!

lG7cl9X2Ilx3xl8VzRLh6g.text: We had trouble finding this place at first, thinking it was a stand-alone restaurant. It's actually located inside the Federal Galley amongst a bar and few other eateries.  We ordered the garlic knots, the Cutch's Curtain Call (hot sausage, chilies, vodka cream sauce) and a create our own (pepperoni, fennel sausage, and ricotta). Came to about $41 without drinks.  Holy. Crap.  Worth the 40 minute drive and every cent. This had to be the best pizza I have tasted. The doughiness, the sauce, the flavors, the crispy cheesiness of the crust.. I was on a food high.   What can I do to get one of these to open up in Baltimore?!  I'll definitely be back the next time I'm in Pittsburgh! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States
Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States
Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States

4wWPwmcdr1aQrC0O1L38XA.text: Located inside a cute little food hall. The food hall is bright and clean, very inviting. You go up to a vendor, order your food, sit down, and they bring it to you.   We decided to try Detroit style pizza while in Detroit. We ordered the Farnsworth Funghi and Woodward Ave White. Both pizzas were absolutely amazing -- great flavor and such a delicious crust. It's almost like a pizza on a grilled cheese. The Woodward Ave white came with ricotta on top which was incredibly delicious and my personal favorite. We also ordered a salad with arugula to start and the vinaigrette was tangy and citrusy, a great starter for the pizza.   Service was wonderful and food was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States. Farnsworth Funghi Woodward Ave White

g5h_d-s-NCIeTdpiLZOxAQ.text: Came to Detroit for a convention and wanted to try the deep dish pizza.  I love Chicago-style deep dish.  I searched Yelp for a place that I could walk to from my hotel, and Michigan & Trumbull has the best reviews.  The restaurant is one of four little places in Fort Street Galley.  The place has some character, and is well set up with clean wooden tables and water bottles and glasses available for free.  We had no trouble getting a table on a Saturday night.  I asked which combo was the best, and they said they were pretty much in order of popularity on the menu.  I didn't want pepperoni, so I got half Farnsworth funghi and half Woodward White.  While it's quite different from Chicago-style pizza, it was really good.  The crust is much more bready than Chicago style, with a lot less cheese.  Still, it was much better than New York style to me.  I really liked the toppings.  My friend got a pepperoni and mushroom pizza, and I liked his a lot less.  The white sauce seemed to work better.  I definitely recommend trying Michigan & Trumbull when in Detroit, especially for the white sauce pizzas.

photos.caption: Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States. Half Farnsworth Funghi, half Woodward White.
Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States. Front of restaurant with menu

T2tZD3t9Mt3Lmwm4AbEJMA.text: Such a travesty that Pittsburgh has lost Michigan & Trumbull, though I wish them the best as they return to their hometown of Detroit. I had no idea that they were leaving this summer, and fortuitiously ordered my favorite Packard Pepperoni pizza to-go while randomly in the area in July. I love a classic pepperoni pizza and adding the pickled chiles and hot honey to the pie make it extra delicious.  Detroit, I hope you know what a gem you're receiving and treat this restaurant as well as the 'Burgh has.

SoZlLrTI6bt5eCfhcnYeJw.text: This was a incredible pop up pizza shop that made a big splash in Pittsburgh during its time here. It's sad to say this place is no longer here but there is high hopes to have them back on Pittsburgh down the road. It was always a classic place to come for good pizza with fast service. The menu was small with big flavors and a lot of focus on the dishes they where putting out. The crust was so buttery and crunchy and the sauce was a sweet red but not over powering sweet. The buffalo chicken was always a good go to with the perfect kick of spice and moist chicken along with fresh scallions. It's a bit pricey but well worth the splurge when you have a pizza craving. I was always excited to talk about this place and spread the word of there good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States

7Biws83u-m3QZdPE2anvzg.text: I love coming to Federal Galley and all the options they have. I've been hesitant to try Michigan & Trumbull because I'm honestly more of a thin crust pizza lover.   Everyone convinced me to try the white pizza. And it was bomb! The red pepper flakes and lemon zest put it over the top! I will definitely be going back for that pizza in the near future!

photos.caption: Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States. White pizza

cYrgjkg2nafPLxb7rhiZWw.text: Michigan & Trumbull is an incubator restaurant set up within the Federal Galley. I was told they were only planning to setup in Pittsburgh since they're based out of Detroit. Detroit style pizza is similar towards deep dish pizza but cheese is already baked around the crust.  They have a few different options but I opted for a build your own with pepperoni and sausage. It was so dang good that I devoured my whole pizza. It was baked perfectly and the amount of cheese had me grinning ear to ear.  My favorite part aside from the crust was the sauce they had. Keep in mind it does take a little bit to make since it's made from scratch. So worth it though!

I_GfMb3hcJm3vf7Rp_F7sw.text: Love Pizza and this place is a must eat for deep dishes style pizza! We were with a group and got a few different Pizzas they were all good ! I love the pepperoni / jalapeno and the pierogi's pizza they were amazing !!!

HMXn9hBsuxc5FYJYhhSZSQ.text: We finally made our pilgrimage to Federal Galley and my husband (who loves pizza) wanted to try M&T.  Not being one to turn down a slice, we decided to split a. Buffalo Chicken pizza and a Yinzer Salad (because you've got to eat your greens).  Well I'm happy to say that we left happy and full of delicious pizza.  Personally, I loved the crust.  It had the Sicilian crunch that I like for the crust -  crunch with the chew of tasty dough!  The drizzle of buffalo sauce on top make me salivate.  So many places put the buffalo sauce on first, then bake the pie.  That just makes it dry and have less of the buffalo kick.  M&T puts the buffalo on the chicken and the sauce on the pizza last.  Leaving that spicy tang for you to enjoy.  Yummy!  Now the Yinzer salad is not tiny.  It has delicious waffle fries with a BBQ chip flavoring to it.  So unique!.  The salad had arugula, bacon, cheddar cheese and ranch dressing.  It was tasty!  I actually put some of top of my Buffalo pizza.  Now that's a delicious bite!  We'll definitely stop by Federal Galley again for some pizza at Michigan &  Trumbull.  I mean where else can you get Detroit style pizza in Pittsburgh?

MQQfzOeuRf4iygQFbuU3yw.text: Finally made my way here, only a few days before they are leaving for Detroit! I tried the buffalo chicken pizza with ranch- it was SUPER good. Wishing them the best of luck in Detroit!

m6f7UVQrzRhZ0fAM0HtasA.text: The perfect pizza does exist... and it's right here at Michigan and Trumbull.    Let me start by saying that buffalo chicken is one of the greatest combinations of food known to humankind. It's spicy. It's tender. It's tasty. It's great by itself and it's even better when you add it to literally ANYTHING.  So when I spotted M&T's buffalo chicken pizza on my Instagram feed, I quickly wiped the drool off my screen, phoned a friend, and made my way to Federal Galley for dinner.   Not that I thought it would, but this pizza did not disappoint.  It was the perfect amount of heat, the cheese was ooey and gooey and melty, the chicken was tender... and the crust.  THE CRUST.  I don't know what they do in that kitchen to make it the perfect mashup of crisp and fluffy... but they do it.  The owner herself stopped over to check on us and offered to bring us some homemade ranch to dip our 'za in.  Ummm yes please!   This particular pizza isn't on the regular menu just yet, but I liken it to what I call the "McRib Effect" - make something that people love, but don't make it available all the time.  Build that cult following.  And when it's time to resurrect the buffalo chicken pizza yet again, I'll be waiting with an empty stomach and extra napkins.

8jc35mPxEKVyn7I2M7gCKg.text: Truly fantastic Detroit style pizza. I've tried the Packard Pepperoni, Woodward Ave White, and St Aubin Sausage and would have a hard time picking a favorite. I like that have vegan options, and they are always coming up with interesting specialty pizzas with unique toppings. The bar in Fort St Galley has pretty extensive brews on tap, mostly Michigan breweries.

photos.caption: Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States. Packard Pepperoni

irjhRlfl7Sz-z_N5vWDj6Q.text: Delicious deep dish pizza! I went with the vegan pizza and it was so tasty. The dough was thick and not overly greasy. It came with arugula on top plus as many veggies as you would like! I had green peppers and tomatoes. One topping they didn't have that I would have liked is banana peppers. It could have used a bit more sauce but still very good. The pizza was the perfect size and I ate all 6 slices! Plus only $8.   Someone else I saw had the buffalo chicken pizza which looked sooo good! I would try that next time!

rdNbCedaOIwHdhzuZYvCLA.text: I am quickly becoming a fan of federal galley and Michigan & Trumbull is definitely my favorite concept there.   On my first visit I tried their mushroom pizza with goat cheese. It was so delicious! I loved the thick crust and earthy aromas.   On this latest visit I tried their featured pizza, the brinner. It had potatoes, breakfast sausage, and a ton of cheese. It honestly was one of the best pizza I have ever had. I also ordered their waffle fries, which were pretty tasty and well spiced; definitely the best fries out of all the restaurants at federal.   If you're having a craving from something sweet you should try one of their floats. I had one with red soda and it was delicious!  Also the service was great. The woman who took our order was incredibly helpful and friendly.  I can't wait to go back and try more of these amazing pizzas!

photos.caption: Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States. Brinner pizza
Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States

9lFRl9MUiOyGjcgPgzdmFw.text: You can find better much better versions of Detroit-Style pizza.  I heard  the owners intend to open a sit-down restaurant by the same name but they'll have some stiff competition. Hopefully the experience at Fort Street Gallery helps them work out some bugs.  We had the Bagley Chorizo pizza and thought it was very overpriced for the size and flavor.  The chorizo was very dry and overcooked, having almost a sand texture.  The dough needed to be crispier on the sides and overall just wasn't that enjoyable.  Detroit is pizza paradise so we thought they will need to up their game if they hope to have long term success.

photos.caption: Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States. Bagley Chorizo-Sounds great, tasted blah.

apGVWuJF1AF5_WTqO8cy_g.text: Vegan pizza!  Vegan pizza!  Vegan pizza!  It was that good, really.  Their sauce is so flavorful and the crisp arugula provided a nice counterpoint to the rich, savory sauce.  And oh yeah, the crust.  Doughy, but not too soft.  Crisp on the edges.  Perfect.  And they let you have as many veggies as you want on the vegan pizza for free.  I had tomatoes, mushrooms and broccoli, and it was delicious.  If you haven't been here yet, what are you waiting for??

vsTg8Cm0idqEadf5aM3G6g.text: Yummy Detroit style pizza. One pizza is enough for a family of three! We had the breakfast style with a fried egg. Yummy!

jVqxjr-80EcY_-omWm9X6w.text: I was at Federal Galley for a meet up and was compelled by 1) the hype about the pizza and 2) menu. The Farnsworth Funghi lured me. I'm a shroom fan.  Okay, so ordered, placed my number on the table and conversed. In no time a pan pizza arrived full of arugula and a liberal amount of goat cheese. At first bite, I tasted the lemon zest. Coupled with the arugula and mozzarella, it was an unexpectedly wonderful mix and balance of flavor. It didn't have as many mushrooms as the name suggested is my only qualm.  I ate half the pizza and took the rest back. Hubs devoured the other half when I got home. A pie became a dinner for two. That's your frame of reference.

photos.caption: Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States. Farnsworth Funghi - lemon zest gives it a good flavor!

D0e89qetwRgAnWgECLYTFw.text: Brought my father here for father's day. The end result was that we loved the two pizzas we got. The pepperoni pizza with the honey drizzled on top was amazing. The honey added a tiny sweet touch to the pie. My father thought they were using a sweet sauce but it was actually just the drizzle of honey. The crust is amazing and seems to have cheese mixed in....creating this wonderful cheesy & crusty edges...yum!!! The only negative to this place is the high prices for such a small 6 piece pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States. Buffalo chicken pizza. Very different!
Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States. Pepperoni pizza with honey drizzle! Sooo good. And that crust is amazing!

RkHgfDJaOAj4txK76z54yw.text: Sometimes I think that Pittsburgh doesn't deserve Detroit-style pizza, which is what Michigan & Trumbull serves.  I first found out about them at the Yelp event held at the Federal Galley. The Woodward White was love at first bite: exquisitely crispy caramelized cheesy edges, with toppings of mozzarella, ricotta, red pepper flake, lemon zest, and garlic oil. Trust me on the lemon zest--it absolutely works.  It's like my favorite light olive oil dressed pasta and a white pizza had a baby. A beautiful, crispy baby.  In fact, it's the only one of their pizzas that I order. I'm sure the others are lovely, but for me, I see no reason to stray from the Woodward White.  Anyway, this is also a great place to visit because there are several other neat offerings in the Federal Galley, so it's easy to go with others and each order from somewhere different, then share all around. The pizza is pretty substantial, so it would be difficult to eat one on your own unless you take leftovers anyway.    If they ever open a new location in Pittsburgh, I would love to see that!

L3pY-OzkTbORjxqURWCz4g.text: YUM! Stopped in for lunch as this place was close to our hotel, and we were not disappointed.  We shared the Packard Pepperoni, and both loved it.  The taste is amazing, with a great blend between the traditional pizza flavors plus a little sweet from their hot honey, and heat from the honey and chiles.  The crust, of course, is the crispy cooked cheese that Detroit style pizza is known for.  I'm back home now, and miss this pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Michigan & Trumbull - Detroit, MI, United States
